topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack 2.0: Configuring for 3PAR Block Storage Backend

body.p: This page describes how to configure your 3PAR backend for the Helion Entry Scale Cloud with KVM model.

ul.li: Your HP Helion Entry Scale Cloud should be up and running. Installation steps can be found here.
3PAR Storage Array should be available in cloud management network or routed to cloud management network and 3PAR FC and iSCSI ports configured.
3PAR management IP and iSCSI port IP's must have connectivity from controller and compute nodes.
Please refer the system requirements for 3PAR in Openstack configuration guide.

section.title: Configure 3PAR FC as Cinder backend
section.p: You must modify cinder.conf.j2 to configure FC details.

Perform the following steps to configure 3PAR FC as Cinder backend:
Login to deployer node.
Edit my_cloud/config/cinder/cinder.conf.j2 to add 3PAR FC backend:
Modify enabled_backends section in cinder.conf.j2 as shown in the following example:enabled_backends=3par_FCAppend this change with the exiting backend, if you have already added VSA as backend.
Copy 3PAR FC section, uncomment it, and modify the values in the cinder.conf.j2 file as shown in the following example:[3par_FC] hp3par_api_url=https://10.1.192.10:8080/api/v1 hp3par_username=helionadmin hp3par_password=helion hp3par_cpg=FC_r5,FC_r1 san_ip=10.1.192.10 san_login=helionadmin san_password=helion volume_driver=cinder.volume.drivers.san.hp.hp_3par_fc.HP3PARFCDriver volume_backend_name=3par_FC Please enter the values which are specific to your environment.
Commit your configuration to a local repository:cd ~/helion/hos/ansible git add -A git commit -m "<commit message>" Enter your commit message <commit message>
Run the configuration processor:cd ~/helion/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost config-processor-run.yml
When you run the Configuration Processor you will be prompted for two passwords. Enter the first password to make the Configuration Processor encrypt its sensitive data, which is comprised of the random inter-service passwords that it generates and the Ansible group_vars and host_vars that it produces for subsequent deploy runs. You will need this key for subsequent Ansible deploy runs and subsequent Configuration Processor runs. If you wish to change an encryption password that you have already used when running the Configuration Processor then enter the new password at the second prompt, otherwise just press carriage return.
For CI purposes you can specify the required passwords on the ansible command line. For example, the command below will disable encryption by the configuration processor ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost config-processor-run.yml -e encrypt="" -e rekey="" If you receive an error during either of these steps then there is an issue with one or more of your configuration files. We recommend that you verify that all of the information in each of your configuration files is correct for your environment and then commit those changes to git using the instructions above.
Before re-running the Configuration Processor after fixing an error you need to run the clean script detailed in the Installation Troubleshooting document.
Run the following command to create a deployment directory.ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost ready-deployment.yml
Run the following command to configure 3PAR FC as a Cinder backend.cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts cinder-reconfigure.yml

section.title: Configure 3PAR iSCSI as Cinder backend
section.p: You must modify cinder.conf.j2 to configure iSCSI details.

ol.li: Change the directory as shown below:cd ~/helion
Edit cinder.conf.j2 file at my_cloud/config/cinder/cinder.conf.j2 to add 3PAR iSCSI backend:
Modify enabled_backends section in cinder.conf.j2 as shown in the following example:enabled_backends=3par_iSCSIAppend this change with the exiting backend, if you have already added VSA as backend.

Copy 3PAR iSCSI section, uncomment it, and modify the values in the cinder.conf.j2 file as shown in the following example:[3par_iSCSI] hp3par_api_url=https://10.1.192.10:8080/api/v1 hp3par_username=helionadmin hp3par_password=helion hp3par_cpg=FC_r1 (valid cpg name. User need to get from system admin) san_ip=10.1.192.10 san_login=helionadmin san_password=helion volume_driver=cinder.volume.drivers.san.hp.hp_3par_iscsi.HP3PARISCSIDriver volume_backend_name=3par_iSCSI hp3par_iscsi_ips=172.32.0.9 (user can provide multiple IP separated by comma) hp3par_iscsi_chap_enabled=true Please enter the values of all the paramters specific to your environment.
Execute the steps (5 -9) mentioned in Configure 3PAR FC as Cinder backend as mentioned above.

body.p: To verify the 3PAR FC and iSCSI backends are configured successfully, please refer to Verify Backend Configuration.
